alert.note: Alert for Bland; Smyth; Tazewell (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 14 at 5:44AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following counties, Bland, Smyth and Tazewell. * WHEN...Until 730 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 527 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms has moved south into Grayson County. The heavy rain which occurred across Tazewell, Bland, and Smyth is gradually coming to an end. However, minor flooding is ongoing or still expected due to the runoff of between 1 and 2 inches of rain. There have been reports of up to 2.5 inches of rain in the town of Tazewell. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Beech Fork, Bluestone River, Burkes Garden Creek, Blue Spring Creek, Big Creek, Clinch River, Campbell Creek and Beaver Creek. Little additional rainfall is expected, however, expect the continuation of the runoff the heavy rain which occurred between 4 and 5 AM EDT. The heaviest rain has occurred occurred in the town of Tazewell, so be on the lookout for street closures and washed out driveways during the morning commute to work. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Richlands... Bluefield... Tazewell... Saltville... Chilhowie... Cedar Bluff... Burkes Garden... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious early this morning. Flooding which occured prior to daybreak may be hard to recognized due to poor visibility, making it harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
